additionalTextInformation.text:
Werner Schade considers this fragment to be a work by a bergamasco or northern Italian artist

.[Dorotheum online database, accessed 07.09.2020](https://www.dorotheum.com/de/l/5590389/)

This woman appears without a chain among a group of figures in a work attributed to Bartolomeo Veneto (Sotheby's New York, 20.05.1993, Lot 12). At the left and right of the woman elements of the men depicted by Veneto are also visible on the present painting. It would seem that this now fragmentary painting was the protoype for the painting auctioned in New York or vice versa. 

[Letter from D. Koepplin to Dorotheum, Vienna, 04.2009]

pageContext.description:
The sitter laughs while she looks over her right shoulder at the viewer, her hair is loose and a chain decorates her neck. 
[cda 2020]

involvedPersons.name: Workshop Lucas Cranach the Elder
involvedPersons.remarks:
[Dorotheum online database, accessed 07.09.2020](https://www.dorotheum.com/de/l/5590389/)
'für Cranach spricht fast nur die Hobelspankette und die Borte des Kleides' (only the chain and the border on the dress suggest an association with Cranach's workshop)
[Letter from D. Koepplin to Dorotheum, Vienna, 04.2009]
[Dr. W. Schade, L. Meyer; Dorotheum online database, accessed 07.09.2020](https://www.dorotheum.com/de/l/5590389/)
